page.title: 12NEWHAVEN: IN AND OUT BY SEA
page.content: There are two forms of sea transport. The ferry service, operated by S.N.C.F.(French Railways), runs from Newhaven to Dieppe. In summer, there are up to six crossings per day while in winter, only two. The crossing time is about four hours. Four boats provide this service - Chartres, Senlac, Cornouaillies and Valancay. These transport both passengers and vehicles, the latter by the "Ro-Ro" method. The port also caters for cargo boats. The major imported cargoes by weight are sand, ballast and roadstone. Vessels carrying this cargo dock on the North Quay but some discharge on the East and West quays. Fruit and vegetables are the other major cargoes brought into Newhaven. The major exports by weight are manufactured articles and scrap metals.
